arm_group.description: Children under 12 years of age who underwent surgery in the Charité - University Medicine Berlin, Campus Virchow - Klinikum in the years 2011/12

brief_summary.textblock:
In the context of the study a retrospective data collection of all anaesthesia protocols of
      children under the age of 12 which underwent surgery in the Charité - University Medicine
      Berlin,  Campus Virchow - Klinikum in the years 2011 and 2012 shall be executed. The
      correlation of the tracheal tube sizes with the weight, age and height shall be evaluated.
      This data collection should serve to reevaluate the already published formulas e.g.
      (Rettberg M. et al., 2011).

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of the Paediatric Tracheal Tube Size

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children under the age of 12 who underwent surgery in the Charité - University
             Medicine Berlin, Charité Campus Virchow - Klinikum in the years 2011/12

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  No endotracheal tube inserted

study_pop.textblock:
Children under the age of 12 who underwent surgery in the Charité - University Medicine
        Berlin, Campus Virchow - Klinikum in the years 2011/12

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine CVK/CCM, Charité - University Medicine

clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of the Paediatric Tracheal Tube Size With the Known Formulas for the Calculation of the Size

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine CVK/CCM, Charité - University Medicine Berlin

primary_outcome.description: For many years different weight, height, and/or age-based formulas have been published. The aim of the present study was to identify and to compare published formulas to estimate optimal tube size in pediatric patients.
primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of the tracheal tube size with the known formulas for the calculation of the size.  Correlation of the tracheal tube size with the known formulas for the calculation of the size

reference.citation: von Rettberg M, Thil E, Genzwürker H, Gernoth C, Hinkelbein J. [Endotracheal tubes in pediatric patients. Published formulas to estimate the optimal size]. Anaesthesist. 2011 Apr;60(4):334-42. doi: 10.1007/s00101-010-1756-0. Review. German.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

responsible_party.investigator_title: Department of Anesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine CVK/CCM

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
